review: There are only 2 apps in it (Netflix and YouTube). Need more excitement. Every piece of technology today, from TV's to DVD players, etc. has more apps. What's the point of getting this one. I had an old Blue Ray DVD player that already has Netflix, YouTube and Pandora. One word, needs more juice. Cool gadget but now just became a part of TV that is not being used

review: While we love its streaming of Youtube content, rest of pure chrome web casting is patchy at best.  Casting stops and terminates for no reason and after several restarts we give up.  It is also not cool that chrome browser can not cast from iPad/iPhones. I am disappointed at this sub-optimal product from Google.

review: P.O.S. Glitchy. Slow. Times out a lot.  This reminds me of the 28k Modem days.  BTW:  My TV is within 5 feet of my ultra high spped DSL wireless router and my computer is within 10 feet of both. This should work just fine - but it is a terrible waste of time.  An HDMI cable from my computer direct to the HDMI port on the TV is a much, much better solution.

review: I have asked Amazon more times than i can count to make their prime video app available on the #1 mobile os (Android) so i can watch on my phone and tablets but for whatever reason they won't. So now I buy my movies from google play and can watch my videos on every device I own. I hope Amazon will make an app but if they insist on pushing Android users away they will find chromecast a big help. Please open your eyes Amazon, I am speaking with my money.
